title: Former Democrat Tulsi Gabbard Endorses Trump For Presidential Polls
content: Former US congresswoman, who left the Democratic Party in 2022 announced her endorsement of former President Donald Trump in the upcoming presidential polls in November, The Hill reported.
summary: Former US congresswoman, who left the Democratic Party in 2022 announced her endorsement of former President Donald Trump in the upcoming presidential polls in November, The Hill reported.

title: Israel Still Faces Threat Of Attack By Iran, Proxies, Says Pentagon
content: The United States continues to assess that the threat of attack against Israel by Iran and its proxy groups still exists, the Pentagon said on Monday.
summary: The United States continues to assess that the threat of attack against Israel by Iran and its proxy groups still exists, the Pentagon said on Monday.

title: Centre Refutes Reports Linking Farakka Barrage To Bangladesh Floods
content: India on Monday trashed reports in Bangladesh that the opening of the Farakka barrage in West Bengal is causing floods in some areas in the neighbouring country.
summary: India on Monday trashed reports in Bangladesh that the opening of the Farakka barrage in West Bengal is causing floods in some areas in the neighbouring country.

title: Canada To Reduce Number Of Temporary Foreign Workers
content: Canada is reducing by tens of thousands the number of temporary foreign workers it brings in, reversing some expansions to the program it made in 2022 as the government struggles to bring down numbers of temporary residents.
summary: Canada is reducing by tens of thousands the number of temporary foreign workers it brings in, reversing some expansions to the program it made in 2022 as the government struggles to bring down numbers of temporary residents.

title: "Not A Political Decision": Macron On Telegram Founder's Arrest In France
content: President Emmanuel Macron on Monday denied any political link to the arrest of Telegram founder Pavel Durov as the tech tycoon spent a second day in French custody following his surprise arrest at a Paris airport.
summary: President Emmanuel Macron on Monday denied any political link to the arrest of Telegram founder Pavel Durov as the tech tycoon spent a second day in French custody following his surprise arrest at a Paris airport.

title: Why Trump Is Threatening To Pull Out Of Debate With Kamala Harris
content: The campaigns of Donald Trump and Kamala Harris clashed on Monday over next month's U.S. presidential debate, with the vice president's team seeking a return to open microphones while her Republican rival threatened to pull out entirely.
summary: The campaigns of Donald Trump and Kamala Harris clashed on Monday over next month's U.S. presidential debate, with the vice president's team seeking a return to open microphones while her Republican rival threatened to pull out entirely.

title: Iran Executes 20-Year-Old Man In Public For Murdering Lawyer
content: Iran carried out on Monday a rare public execution of a man over the murder of a lawyer two years ago, state media reported.
summary: Iran carried out on Monday a rare public execution of a man over the murder of a lawyer two years ago, state media reported.

title: There Can't Be Any Divisions Among People: Muhammad Yunus To Hindu Leaders
content: Bangladesh's interim government chief Muhammad Yunus on Monday met the country's Hindu community leaders and vowed to promote interfaith harmony as he hosted a reception for them coinciding with Janmashtami.
summary: Bangladesh's interim government chief Muhammad Yunus on Monday met the country's Hindu community leaders and vowed to promote interfaith harmony as he hosted a reception for them coinciding with Janmashtami.

title: Explained: Clashes Between Israel And Hezbollah Since 2006 War
content: After an escalation of hostilities Sunday amid over 10 months of cross-border clashes between Israel and Lebanon's powerful Hezbollah movement, here are the major eruptions of violence since their 2006 war.
summary: After an escalation of hostilities Sunday amid over 10 months of cross-border clashes between Israel and Lebanon's powerful Hezbollah movement, here are the major eruptions of violence since their 2006 war.

title: Drugs Gang Of Indian-origin Men Using Frozen Chicken As Cover Busted In UK
content: A gang involving Indian-origin men that used frozen chicken consignments among their many covers to smuggle drugs has been busted by UK police and now its members face prison sentences ranging between 16 and two years each.
summary: A gang involving Indian-origin men that used frozen chicken consignments among their many covers to smuggle drugs has been busted by UK police and now its members face prison sentences ranging between 16 and two years each.

title: Telegram Founder Arrested: The Global Rise Of Libertarian Chat App
content: The boss of social media platform Telegram has been arrested in France, accused of allowing the sharing of illegal content.
summary: The boss of social media platform Telegram has been arrested in France, accused of allowing the sharing of illegal content.

title: Pavel Durov Has "Nothing To Hide", Says Telegram After France Arrest
content: France held the Russian-born founder of Telegram Pavel Durov in custody for a second day of questioning on Monday over alleged offences related to the popular but controversial messaging app, which insisted he had "nothing to hide".
summary: France held the Russian-born founder of Telegram Pavel Durov in custody for a second day of questioning on Monday over alleged offences related to the popular but controversial messaging app, which insisted he had "nothing to hide".

title: Deadly Knife Attack In Germany: What We Know So Far
content:
A knife attack at a street festival in western Germany killed three people on Friday.
A Syrian man has been detained on suspicion of carrying out the rampage on behalf of the Islamic State (IS) group.
summary:
A knife attack at a street festival in western Germany killed three people on Friday.
A Syrian man has been detained on suspicion of carrying out the rampage on behalf of the Islamic State (IS) group.

title: Explained: How US' New Missile Will Be A Game-Changer In Indo-Pacific
content: The US has deployed its new long-range air-to-air missile that could potentially disrupt the balance of power in the Indo-Pacific in the US-China 'Cold War'.
summary: The US has deployed its new long-range air-to-air missile that could potentially disrupt the balance of power in the Indo-Pacific in the US-China 'Cold War'.

title: Japan Scrambles Jets After China Aircraft "Volates" Airspace
content: Japan scrambled fighter jets after a Chinese military aircraft "violated" Japanese airspace, the defence ministry said Monday.
summary: Japan scrambled fighter jets after a Chinese military aircraft "violated" Japanese airspace, the defence ministry said Monday.

title: Russia Hit Ukraine With Over 100 Missiles, Around 100 Drones: Zelensky
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky said Monday that Russia had carried out strikes on Ukraine using more than 100 missiles and around 100 drones.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky said Monday that Russia had carried out strikes on Ukraine using more than 100 missiles and around 100 drones.

title: Video: Elon Musk Shares Rare Glimpse Of Tesla's Cortex AI Supercluster
content: Billionaire Elon Musk has shared a rare glimpse into the inner workings of Tesla's latest innovation - Cortex, a cutting-edge AI training supercluster being built at Tesla Headquarters in Austin.
summary: Billionaire Elon Musk has shared a rare glimpse into the inner workings of Tesla's latest innovation - Cortex, a cutting-edge AI training supercluster being built at Tesla Headquarters in Austin.

title: Video: Russian Skyscraper Hit By Ukrainian Drone In 9/11-Like Attack
content: A Ukrainian drone strike on a residential building in Saratov, Russia, has drawn chilling comparisons to the 9/11 attacks, as video footage of the incident circulates on social media.
summary: A Ukrainian drone strike on a residential building in Saratov, Russia, has drawn chilling comparisons to the 9/11 attacks, as video footage of the incident circulates on social media.

title: "Don't Want To Increase Tensions With Israel, But...": Iran Minister
content: Iran does not seek to increase Middle East tensions, Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi told his Italian counterpart Antonio Tajani, adding that its response to the killing of the Hamas chief in Tehran would be "definite and calculated".
summary: Iran does not seek to increase Middle East tensions, Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi told his Italian counterpart Antonio Tajani, adding that its response to the killing of the Hamas chief in Tehran would be "definite and calculated".

title: Uber Fined $324 Million In Netherlands For Sending Drivers' Data To US
content: The Dutch data protection watchdog said Monday it hit ride-hailing app Uber with a 290-million-euro ($324 million) fine over the transfer of personal data of European drivers to US servers.
summary: The Dutch data protection watchdog said Monday it hit ride-hailing app Uber with a 290-million-euro ($324 million) fine over the transfer of personal data of European drivers to US servers.
